channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 10-Year Treasury Yield Hits Highest Level Since November 2023
item.description: Ten-year Treasury yields rose to their highest level since November 2023, and Generali Investments said about one third of the the nearly 40bps rise s...

item.title: ‘I reaped financial rewards’: I’m 51. My wife is 60. I have $4 million in savings. Should I give up my $300K advisory job to spend time with my wife?
item.description: “I worked in finance, top-tier private equity, for several years and reaped financial rewards.”

item.title: Dollar, Treasury Yields Rise to 2-Year High After Strong Data Dims Rate-Cut Hopes
item.description: The dollar hit fresh highs against several currencies and U.S. 10-year borrowing costs increased in tandem, continuing their rise since strong jobs da...

item.title: S&P 500 Futures Fall, Bond Yields Gain
item.description: Stock futures fell, with the tech-focused Nasdaq-100 leading losses, while stock markets declined across Europe and Asia.

item.title: Celebrities who lost their homes in the L.A. fires
item.description: Multiple stars have lost their homes to the flames, which began in Pacific Palisades Jan. 7 and quickly spread to Malibu and Santa Monica.

item.title: The 30-year yield is on the cusp of 5% as post-payrolls sell-off continues
item.description: Bond yields continue to march higher Monday in the wake of jobs data that suggest the Federal Reserve might make little, if any, change to policy rate...

item.title: The bull market is still intact, this strategist says. This pullback is just the cost of doing business.
item.description: The S&P 500 is probably halfway through its setback already, says Truist strategist.

item.title: The White House just issued new AI chip export limits; Nvidia stock is lower.
item.description: The White House on Monday announced new restrictions on artificial intelligence exports that will impact companies including Nvidia.

item.title: Europe's Gas Prices Rise Amid Lower Reserves
item.description: European natural-gas prices rose more than 4% after colder weather across the continent drove up demand, raising concerns over the state of reserves w...

item.title: Why Bond Yields Are Surging Around the World
item.description: The selloff in government debt is making it costlier to borrow, jarring stocks and pressuring indebted countries.
